story.description: Travel-rating service Trip Advisor is being investigated in Italy over concerns the site is not doing enough to prevent fake reviews.
story.title: Trip Advisor 'fake reviews' probed

story.description: Microsoft unveils the Surface Pro 3, a Windows 8 tablet with a large 12in (30.5cm) touchscreen that it says is a "laptop replacement".
story.title: Microsoft unveils larger Surface Pro

story.description: The publisher of Wolfenstein censors its Nazi imagery to release a version of the cult game in Germany for the first time.
story.title: Wolfenstein has first German release

story.description: Openreach needs to speed up repairs for telephone line faults and broadband installation, Ofcom has ruled.
story.title: BT told to fix faults 'in two days'

story.description: Beijing bans the use of Windows 8 on government computers as a reaction to the firm's decision to stop supporting its older XP operating system.
story.title: China bans Microsoft Windows 8

story.description: The company has warned people not to spend too long using its eyewear technology, because it may cause pain.
story.title: Google Glass can hurt, doctor warns

story.description: Mobile network coverage on Britain's roads and railways is patchy according to a new report
story.title: Patchy mobile coverage on UK roads

story.description: Wearable camera-maker GoPro plans to sell shares in the US with proceeds to go towards repaying debt and future acquisitions.
story.title: GoPro plans US stock market listing

story.description: Android and Apple apps have been shown running side-by-side on the same gadgets thanks to software developed by US computer scientists.
story.title: Apple apps made to run on Android

story.description: A major investigation into whether mobile phones and other wireless technologies affect children's mental development is getting under way.
story.title: Mobile phone child health risk probe

story.description: China denies it has conducted cyber espionage, saying the US is guilty of "double standards" for spying and conducting cyber thefts on other countries.
story.title: China denounces cyber-theft charges

story.description: Seventeen men in the UK are arrested as part of a worldwide crackdown on cyber-criminals attempting to remotely control people's computers and webcams.
story.title: Arrests in computer malware probe

story.description: Ten people involved in overseeing the Bitcoin virtual currency have resigned from its controlling body.
story.title: Bitcoin backers hit by resignations

story.description: A US cyber-thief who helped run a website that dealt in stolen credit cards has been jailed for 20 years.
story.title: Cyber-thief gets 20-year jail term

story.description: Game intends to relist on the London Stock Exchange two years after the video game retailer collapsed into administration.
story.title: Game set for stock market flotation

story.description: Mobile phone industry giants Apple and Google agree to dismiss lawsuits they have brought against each other over technology patents.
story.title: Apple and Google settle patent row

story.description: A new competition backed by GCHQ and the National Crime Agency is looking for members of the public to show off their digital skills.
story.title: GCHQ seeks recruits with competition

story.description: The algorithm which claims it can predict photo-sharing success before you post it online. Spencer Kelly reports.
story.title: VIDEO: The formula to online photo success?

story.description: A site offering live views from the International Space Station, plus other websites reviewed.
story.title: VIDEO: Space station's live view of Earth

story.description: Dan Simmons reports from the slums of Nairobi at the launch of a project which could see 150,000 people own their own computer.
story.title: VIDEO: Nairobi's young using USB to connect

story.description: A UK store which insists that customers pay for transactions in bitcoins, plus other news
story.title: VIDEO: Tech review: This week's headlines

story.description: The 27ft loudspeaker is to go on display at London's Science Museum as part of a new art installation by Aleksander Kolkowski.
story.title: VIDEO: 'Best loudspeaker' goes on display

story.description: Insurance companies back plans to implement automated braking which uses new technology to override drivers
story.title: VIDEO: Automated braking put to the test

story.description: Shift workers and night owls might rarely have the opportunity to listen to breakfast programmes on the radio, but now they can listen to morning broadcasts 24 hours a day thanks to an online project.
story.title: AUDIO: Breakfast radio... 24 hours a day

story.description: Bryan Roberts, an analyst from Kantar Retail, explains how has Dixons has managed to survive in a time of struggling high streets and failing electronics retailers.
story.title: VIDEO: Analyst explains Dixons' survival

story.description: A solar power system has been developed that allows computers to work while they are being charged.
story.title: VIDEO: 'Plug and play': Solar charging a PC

story.description: Japanese astronaut Koichi Wakata says goodbye to his humanoid robot companion, Kirobo, as he wraps up his mission aboard the International Space Station.
story.title: VIDEO: Astronaut says goodbye to robot companion

story.description: Simon Nicholas who campaigns against LED street lights says they pose health issues and can stop people sleeping.
story.title: VIDEO: LED streetlights 'stop people sleeping'

story.description: App aims to catch problems before symptoms appear
story.title: VIDEO: App gives check-up to cats and dogs

story.description: Is $15m machine a glimpse of future computing?
story.title: D-Wave: Is $15m machine a glimpse of future computing?

story.description: The technologies helping business make sustainability profitable
story.title: War on waste helps businesses profit

story.description: Why might Google pay $1bn for a games broadcaster?
story.title: How can game clips be worth $1bn?

story.description: Sending satellites into orbit for £200
story.title: Tiny satellites hitch into space

story.description: US cyber-spy charges send a message to China
story.title: US calls out '21st Century burglary'

story.description: Mini-satellites show new views of life on Earth
story.title: Mini-satellites watch life on Earth

story.description: Code crackers reunite thanks to a rediscovered photo
story.title: Lost picture aids Colossus reunion
